title: Steven Spielberg shares photos, writes open letter after wrapping West Side Story remake
text:
He's one of the most distinguished Hollywood film directors in the world, and he just wrapped production on a brand new version of one of the most iconic musicals of all time.

Steven Spielberg shared some exciting images from the set of his just-wrapped West Side Story on Wednesday, along with a heartfelt open letter of gratitude for his cast, crew and the original creators of the Tony- and Oscar-winning musical production.

In Spielberg's post, which was through his production company Amblin Entertainment's account, several key players are seen, most notably Rita Moreno — who won an Oscar for her portrayal of quick-mouthed Anita in the 1961 original film, and who will be portraying new character Valentina in the remake.

Steven and Rita: Steven Spielberg shared some exciting images from the set of his just-wrapped West Side Story on Wednesday, most notably a snap with original player Rita Moreno

The Oscar-winning director, 72, poses with Moreno, 87, in one of the shared images, with Rita seemingly in costume while on the film's set.

Another image shows Steven being embraced by his leading man Ansel Elgort, along with newcomers Rachel Zegler, Ariana DeBose and David Alvarez.

In his open letter, Steven took time not only to thank everyone directly involved in the film's production, but also the residents of New York City, where West Side Story is based, as well.

'We’ve just concluded filming our version of West Side Story,' Spielberg wrote. 'This has been a journey without precedence: a joyful, stunningly moving, endlessly surprising encounter with the story and score of one of the world’s greatest musicals.'

Thank you: The Oscar-winning director also posted a heartfelt open letter of gratitude for his cast, crew and the original creators of the Tony- and Oscar-winning musical production

At work: Spielberg directed several relative newcomers for the film, including Ariana DeBose and David Alvarez; seen here in July on location

'My brilliantly talented, fiercely committed, generous and apparently inexhaustible cast and crew of hundreds have given our film everything they’ve got, and already I can say that the film we’ll be releasing on December 18, 2020, owes everything to them, as does its immensely grateful director,' he graciously continued.

'I and my team, cast and crew have been walking in the footsteps of four giants: Leonard Bernstein, Arthur Laurents, Jerome Robbins and Stephen Sondheim [the original creators of WSS]. For the light they’ve shed on the world, for Stephen Sondheim’s insight, guidance and support, and for the openhearted support of the Bernstein, Laurents and Robbins estates, I owe more than I can possibly express.'

'We filmed West Side Story all over New York, from Flatbush to Fort Tryon Park. The city lent us its beauty and its energy, and we drew deeply upon its grand, multicultural, multifaceted spirit,' the renowned filmmaker wrote.

Giving recognition: 'My brilliantly talented, fiercely committed, generous and apparently inexhaustible cast and crew of hundreds have given our film everything they’ve got,' Spielberg gushed, seen here on the film's set in August

Spielberg went on to specifically thank 'the people of New York,' saying 'thanks not only for putting up with our trailers, tents, cranes and mid-street dance sequences; from the bottom of my heart, thanks for the warm welcome we encountered everywhere, from pedestrians and policemen and neighborhoods and kids. We couldn’t have made our musical without you.'

Elgort, 25, and Zegler, 17, play star-crossed lovers Tony and Maria in the story, loosely based on the Shakespearean tragedy of Romeo And Juliet, in which the warring noble families are replaced by rival street gangs.

The original 1957 Broadway production of West Side Story won Tony Awards for choreography and scenic design, and the 1961 film adaptation starring Natalie Wood won ten out of its 11 Oscar nominations, including trophies for Moreno, supporting actor George Chakiris, as well as Best Picture of the Year.

The new version of West Side Story will hit theaters in December 2020.
